intro: Gomphia striata, commonly known as the striped gomphia, is a member of the Restionaceae family and is native to South Africa. It is a perennial herb characterized by its tufted, grass-like foliage with narrow, linear leaves that have distinct longitudinal stripes. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters, typically in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
